summary: The U.S. government sends many kinds of cargo overseas, from military supplies to food for nations in need. By law, a certain percentage of that cargo must be sent on ships registered in the U.S. We testified that the Maritime Administration (MARAD) monitors the percentage of cargo that agencies send on oceangoing ships. MARAD receives data from shippers, including cargo volumes carried by U.S. and...
title: Maritime Administration: Actions Needed to Enhance Cargo Preference Oversight
